pr_title: CCS-3270: File name not displayed instead of the title in search results on uploading the module twice

timeline.message: Fix: Module title is now appearing on every module upload

timeline.bodyText:
The problem with this approach is that I don't think it takes in consideration when the title name changes.
So if module version2 has a different title I don't think this will update the title metadata right?
timeline.author: jmarrero

replies.bodyText: Joseph is correct here, the title attribute comes from the content itself and gets populated in the html generation phase (line 174). I think this section should be moved to line 185 so that the default title only gets populated IFF there is no module title. See line 180-184 for a similar approach with a different property.
replies.author: carlosmunoz

replies.bodyText: Ankit tested this, and showed it to me, It looks like my assumption is wrong this works because when we upload the second version it is creating a second metadata object if the file is new. If not then it does a get. This is thanks to the getorcreate magic.
replies.author: jmarrero
